intro: Campium lanceolatum, commonly known as the lanceolate campion, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae, which includes other well-known plants like the carnation and sweet William. The plant features slender, upright stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its showy pink or red flowers bloom in clusters, typically from late spring to early summer. Campium lanceolatum is often found in meadows, woodland edges, and rocky soils, thriving in full sun to partial shade.
